item.title: John add a quote by Apple Computer Inc.
item.description: "Here's to the crazy ones. The misfits. The rebels. The troublemakers. The round pegs in the square holes. The ones who see things differently. They're not fond of rules. And they have no respect for the status quo. You can quote them, disagree with them, glorify or vilify them. About the only thing you can't do is ignore them. Because they change things. They push the human race forward. And while some may see them as the crazy ones, we see genius. Because the people who are crazy enough to think they can change the world, are the ones who do." -- Apple Computer Inc.

item.title: John add a quote by Émile Zola
item.description: "If you ask me what I came to do in this world, I, an artist, will answer you: I am here to live out loud." -- Émile Zola

item.title: John add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: John add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: John add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Don't walk behind me; I may not lead. Don't walk in front of me; I may not follow. Just walk beside me and be my friend." -- Albert Camus

item.title: John add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "Resist much, obey little." -- Walt Whitman

item.title: John add a quote by E. E. Cummings
item.description: "Unbeing dead isn't being alive." -- E. E. Cummings

item.title: John add a quote by Samuel Beckett
item.description: "Estragon: Nothing to be done." -- Samuel Beckett

item.title: John add a quote by James Baldwin
item.description: "True rebels after all, are as rare as true lovers,and in both cases, to mistake a fever for passion can destroy one's life" -- James Baldwin

item.title: John add a quote by Saul Bellow
item.description: "Unexpected intrusions of beauty. This is what life is." -- Saul Bellow

item.title: John add a quote by Saul Bellow
item.description: "You never have to change anything you got up in the middle of the night to write." -- Saul Bellow

item.title: John add a quote by Saul Bellow
item.description: "People can lose their lives in libraries. They ought to be warned." -- Saul Bellow

item.title: John add a quote by P.G. Wodehouse
item.description: "There is no surer foundation for a beautiful friendship than a mutual taste in literature." -- P.G. Wodehouse

item.title: John add a quote by William Henry Davies
item.description: "What is this life if, full of care, We have no time to stand and stare?" -- William Henry Davies

item.title: John add a quote by William Henry Davies
John add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "Do not fear to be eccentric in opinion, for every opinion now accepted was once eccentric." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: John add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "Of all forms of caution, caution in love is perhaps the most fatal to true happiness." -- Bertrand Russell

item.title: John add a quote by C.P. Snow
item.description: "When you think of the long and gloomy history of man, you will find more hideous crimes have been committed in the name of obedience than have ever been committed in the name of rebellion." -- C.P. Snow

item.title: John add a quote by Joe Klein
item.description: "Faith, unaccompanied by rigorous skepticism, is a recipe for myopia and foolishness." -- Joe Klein

item.title: John add a quote by Rosa Luxemburg
item.description: "Being human means throwing your whole life on the scales of destiny when need be, all the while rejoicing in every sunny day and every beautiful cloud." -- Rosa Luxemburg

item.title: John add a quote by Rosa Luxemburg
item.description: "Those who do not move, do not notice their chains." -- Rosa Luxemburg

item.title: John add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "Facts do not cease to exist because they are ignored." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: John add a quote by Chinua Achebe
item.description: "While we do our good works let us not forget that the real solution lies in a world in which charity will have become unnecessary." -- Chinua Achebe

item.title: John add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "This is what you shall do; Love the earth and sun and the animals, despise riches, give alms to every one that asks, stand up for the stupid and crazy, devote your income and labor to others, hate tyrants, argue not concerning God, have patience and indulgence toward the people, take off your hat to nothing known or unknown or to any man or number of men, go freely with powerful uneducated persons and with the young and with the mothers of families, read these leaves in the open air every season of every year of your life, re-examine all you have been told at school or church or in any book, dismiss whatever insults your own soul, and your very flesh shall be a great poem and have the richest fluency not only in its words but in the silent lines of its lips and face and between the lashes of your eyes and in every motion and joint of your body." -- Walt Whitman

item.title: John add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "Youth is happy because it has the capacity to see beauty. Anyone who keeps the ability to see beauty never grows old." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: John add a quote by Charles Fourier
item.description: "Despots prefer the friendship of the dog, who, unjustly mistreated and debased, still loves and serves the man who wronged him." -- Charles Fourier

item.title: John add a quote by Daphne Du Maurier
item.description: "Happiness is not a possession to be prized, it is a quality of thought, a state of mind." -- Daphne Du Maurier

item.title: John add a quote by Daphne du Maurier
item.description: "But luxury has never appealed to me, I like simple things, books, being alone, or with somebody who understands." -- Daphne du Maurier

item.title: John add a quote by Rachel Corrie
item.description: "We should be inspired by people... who show that human beings can be kind, brave, generous, beautiful, strong-even in the most difficult circumstances." -- Rachel Corrie

item.title: John add a quote by André Breton
item.description: "My wish is that you may be loved to the point of madness." -- André Breton
